description: TEHRAN – “The Boyfriend” by American author Freida McFadden has recently been published in Persian.
title: Freida McFadden’s “The Boyfriend” at Iranian bookstores

description: TEHRAN – Iran’s first professional film music orchestra is set to perform iconic soundtracks from world-famous movies and series.
title: Tehran Film Music Symphony Orchestra to debut at Vahdat Hall

description: TEHRAN – The early works of renowned Turkish director Nuri Bilge Ceylan, the films "Small Town” (“Kasaba") and "Cocoon” (“Koza"), are set to be showcased as part of the World Experimental Cinema series at the Art and Experience Cinema Group in Tehran.
title: Nuri Bilge Ceylan's early works to go on screen in Tehran

description: TEHRAN - In an analysis, Hamshahri addressed the return of the “nuclear consortium” idea and wrote: Indirect negotiations between Iran and the United States are underway in a situation where several issues, including the right to enrich within Iranian territory, have become one of the main sticking points between the parties.
title: Return of “nuclear consortium” idea

description: TEHRAN – The commander of Iran’s Islamic Revolution Guards Corps (IRGC), Major General Hossein Salami, has firmly rejected any threats of military action from the United States or Israel, stressing that Iran is fully prepared to confront and repel any aggression.
title: ‘Our fingers are on the trigger’: IRGC commander says Iran ready for all scenarios

description: TEHRAN – Deputy Foreign Minister for Legal and International Affairs Kazem Gharibabadi held separate meetings with the ambassadors of China and Russia on Wednesday to discuss cooperation within BRICS and the Shanghai Cooperation Organization (SCO), as well as the latest updates on Iran-U.S. negotiations.
title: Deputy FM talks multilateral, international matters with Chinese and Russian envoys

description: TEHRAN – Iranian Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi delivered a stark warning to the United Kingdom on Tuesday, stating that London's apparent insistence on "zero enrichment" in Iran renders further dialogue on the nuclear issue futile.
title: ‘Nothing left’ to discuss with UK if it demands zero enrichment, Araghchi declares

description: JINAN, China –In the global race toward sustainable transportation, China has positioned itself as a frontrunner through remarkable advancements in green energy vehicles.
title: China’s green tech triumph: How the BYD Jinan Base is shaping global sustainable industry

description: TEHRAN – The Iranian Judiciary has announced the execution of Pedram Madani, convicted of espionage for the Israeli regime's Mossad intelligence service and large-scale financial corruption.
title: Mossad spy Pedram Madani executed: Iran’s Judiciary

description: TEHRAN – An aid delivery system set up by a U.S.-backed company in Gaza crumbles, triggering international condemnation.
title: Outcry over U.S.-Israeli aid mechanism

description: SOUTH LEBANON — During his speech at the Arab Media Summit in Dubai, Lebanese Prime Minister Nawaf Salam claimed that the Lebanese project is based on “liberation from the duality of arms.”
title: Lebanese government violates its own constitution

description: TEHRAN - On Tuesday, thousands of Palestinians clambered over fences to reach the humanitarian supplies at a distribution site run by the previously unknown, U.S.-backed Gaza Humanitarian Foundation (GHF), in Rafah, southern Gaza, Al Jazeera reported.
title: Humiliating starved people

description: TEHRAN – Five Iranian presidents have made six visits to Oman over approximately 20 years, while Omani sultans have visited Iran three times. Of course, Iran-Oman relations have historical roots, but the relationship between the Islamic Republic of Iran and the Sultanate of Oman gained momentum in the early 1980s, progressing steadily toward strengthening ties.
title: Oman and Iran can now be considered strategic partners

description: TEHRAN – Iran’s top national security official has warned that unilateralism in international politics has led to widespread humanitarian disasters across the globe, with the situation in Gaza representing one of the most severe manifestations of this trend.
title: Gaza symbolizes the tragedy of unilateralism in global politics: Top security official

description: TEHRAN – Iran has signaled it may allow American inspectors working for the International Atomic Energy Organization (IAEA) to monitor its nuclear program—but only if ongoing negotiations result in a favorable agreement for Tehran.
title: Iran may accept US nuclear inspectors if a deal is reached, says atomic chief

description: TEHRAN – The Leader of the Islamic Revolution, Ayatollah Seyyed Ali Khamenei, held a meeting with Iran’s interior minister and the country's provincial governors on Wednesday.
title: SCO and BRICS valuable opportunities for Iran: Leader

description: TEHRAN- Iran will not agree to halt uranium enrichment as a result of ongoing talks with the United States, Iran’s Foreign Ministry Spokesman declared to the Tehran Times, following Reuters' report suggesting Iran might consider the move in exchange for the unfreezing of billions of its assets held by the U.S.
title: Iran denies reports of potential agreement on a temporary pause in uranium enrichment

description: Harvard University will relinquish 175-year-old photographs believed to be the earliest taken of enslaved people to a South Carolina museum devoted to African American history as part of a settlement with one of the subjects’ descendants.
title: Harvard agrees in settlement to relinquish early photos of slaves

description: Ambassador Yuval Waks was forced to leave a university campus in Dakar on Tuesday after students protested against his presence and chanted slogans against the Israeli war on Gaza, according to footage circulating on social media.
title: Protesters force Israeli ambassador to leave Senegal university

description: Nearly 380 writers from the UK and Ireland have signed an open letter demanding an immediate ceasefire in Gaza, labelling Israel’s actions in the enclave a “genocide”.
title: UK and Irish writers pen open letter calling for Gaza ceasefire

description: The world’s nations are gathering in France next month to tackle what the United Nations calls a global emergency facing the world’s oceans as they confront rising temperatures, plastic pollution choking marine life, and relentless overexploitation of fish and other resources.
title: Nations to gather in France to tackle global emergency in oceans

description: The State Department has halted the scheduling of new visa interviews for foreign students hoping to study in the U.S. while it prepares to expand the screening of their activity on social media, officials said.
title: US stops scheduling visa interviews for foreign students, expands social media vetting

description: A German court has thrown out a Peruvian farmer’s lawsuit seeking damages from RWE for the German energy utility’s alleged role in putting his hometown at risk through climate change, but set a potentially important precedent on polluters’ liability for their carbon emissions.
title: German court rejects Peruvian farmer’s climate case against RWE

description: TEHRAN – Azerbaijan’s Rashad Mammadov was named as new head coach of Iran’s men’s judo team on Wednesday.
title: Rashad Mammadov named Iran’s judo coach

description: Japan’s ambassador to Iran, Tsukada Tamaki, visited the Tehran Times office on Wednesday, where he engaged with the publication's CEO and Editor-in-Chief. He then discussed the current state of Iran-Japan relations and shared his hopes and vision for the future during an interview with a correspondent.
title: Japanese ambassador talks bilateral relations in Tehran Times visit

description: TEHRAN—Head of Iran’s National Council on Aging Secretariat, Mojgan Rezazadeh, gave news of launching special elderly hotels and said the council is studying, compiling, and standardizing new centers such as special elderly hotels known as silver generation hotels.
title: Iran to launch specialized hotels for the elderly

description: TEHRAN - Gildeh, a village in the central district of Shaft county, Gilan province, hosted a rosewater festival.
title: Gildeh, village of rose and rosewater

description: TEHRAN--Iranian Minister of Cultural Heritage, Tourism, and Handicrafts, Seyyed Reza Salehi-Amiri, announced the beginning of tourism exchange between Iran and Egypt in near future.
title: Iran, Egypt to begin tourist exchanges soon: cultural heritage minister

description: TEHRAN - Recent archaeological discoveries made during urban development projects in Yas Park, located in northern Tehran, have been confirmed to date back to the Qajar and early Pahlavi periods.
title: Artifacts from Qajar and early Pahlavi eras discovered in Tehran park

description: TEHRAN - The Imam Khomeini Stadium in Arak is poised to host the highly anticipated final of Iran's Hazfi Cup on Thursday, a clash between Esteghlal and Malavan.
title: Esteghlal and Malavan set for thrilling Hazfi Cup final showdown

description: TEHRAN – Finland’s Ambassador to Iran, Jani Johannes Raippana, has praised Iran’s vast investment potential, particularly in the northern province of Mazandaran, describing its economic capacities as “unparalleled,” especially in the fields of tourism, fisheries, agriculture, and mining.
title: Finnish ambassador visits Mazandaran, honors environmental legacy of ‘Mother of the Cranes’

description: TEHRAN – After a temporary closure, the Treasury of National Jewels in Tehran is once again welcoming visitors, starting Saturday, May 31 (10 Khordad in the Iranian calendar).
title: Treasury of National Jewels to reopen to the public in Tehran

description: TEHRAN- Iranian President Masoud Pezeshkian said that the value of trade between Iran and Oman can reach $20 billion-$30 billion.
title: Trade between Iran, Oman can reach $20b-$30b: Pezeshkian

description: TEHRAN – Sardar Azmoun and Alireza Jahanbakhsh will not be playing against Qatar and North Korea in the 2026 FIFA World Cup qualifiers.
title: Jahanbakhsh, Azmoun miss Qatar and North Korea matches

description: TEHRAN – The customs chiefs of Iran and Turkey signed a bilateral cooperation agreement during a meeting in which both sides expressed determination to boost trade ties.
title: Iran, Turkey customs authorities sign cooperation agreement

description: TEHRAN – Afghan nationals who are university students, vulnerable women heads of households, children with an Iranian parent, and those who have a job code are allowed to live in the country.
title: Which Afghan nationals are allowed to stay in Iran?

description: TEHRAN – Trade between Iran and Austria reached $220 million in 2024, marking a five percent increase from the previous year, according to the International Affairs Department of the Iran Chamber of Commerce, Industries, Mines and Agriculture (IRICA).
title: Annual trade between Iran, Austria rises to $220m

description: TEHRAN – Iran’s trade with member states of the Economic Cooperation Organization (ECO) reached 36.2 million tons worth $27.6 billion in the Iranian calendar year 1403 (ended March 19, 2025), according to the Islamic Republic of Iran Customs Administration (IRICA).
title: Iran's trade with ECO member states hits $27.6b in a year

description: TEHRAN- The value of non-oil trade between Iran and China stood at $1.765 billion in the first Iranian calendar month of Farvardin (March 21-April 21, 2025), according to data from the Islamic Republic of Iran Customs Administration (IRICA).
title: Iran-China monthly non-oil trade stands at $1.765b

description: TEHRAN – The dedication and commendable efforts of all member states have transformed the Shanghai Cooperation Organization (SCO) into a powerful institution, particularly in the fight against illicit drugs, Mohammad Narimani, an official with the Drug Control Headquarters (DCHQ), has said.
title: SCO turned into a powerful force in fight against narcotics: official

description: TEHRAN – The Seventh Meeting of the Conference of the Parties to the Framework Convention for the Protection of the Marine Environment of the Caspian Sea, known as COP 7, which will be held in Tehran, will focus on the preservation of the Caspian seal.
title: COP 7 in Tehran to focus on Caspian seal protection

description: TEHRAN – Supported by the World Health Organization (WHO), key representatives from the health ministry, medical faculties, non-governmental organizations, and palliative care providers have met to develop a technical paper on palliative care to be presented to the upcoming 72nd Session of the WHO Regional Committee (RC72) resolution.
title: WHO supports Iran in preparing paper on palliative care for RC72

description: TEHRAN – Amid a rapidly transforming technological landscape, the Iranian capital played host to a pivotal event this week: the 2nd Ministerial Meeting of the OIC-15 Dialogue Platform.
title: OIC-15: Islamic policymakers ready for AI-dominated industrial revolution
